root.name: effective charge
root.description: [b]Returns effective charge (according to Barkas-Bethe approximation) as a function of particle energy per nucleon[/b]

element.label: ion kinetic energy min [MeV/amu]
element.description: Ion kinetic energy (MeV/amu), minimum value for data series.[br][br] In libamtrack, the kinetic energy for particles is usually given in Megaelectronvolt per nucleon (MeV/u). For therapeutical beam these are usually in range between approx. 1 MeV/u and 500 MeV/u. [br] Please note, that simply the number of nucleons is used, not the actual mass of the nucleon (amu) for a specific nuclid. So, for example for U-238 with 100 MeV/u the total kinetic energy is 23.8 GeV.
